page.title: 09JAZZ BANDS IN SWANSEA
page.content: Many children here belong to jazz bands. These originated in the miners' strike of 1926, when many of the men channelled their energy into dressing up and parading the streets. Now children carry on the tradition, competing for the honour of being champion band in colourful uniforms, often with a military flavour. The training is rigorous, - strict weekly practices in countermarching, playing their kazoos (a 'comb-and-paper' type instrument) and drumming. Each band is linked to a specific area, - e.g., Clase Silver Crystals. In competitions, each band executes a complicated 12 min. programme under the gaze of 6 judges, who assess the precision of the marching, the skill of the baton-twirling majorette, the music and the drumming. It is a proud band which carries its trophies home!
